title: R O 6: The Heart of Addiction is Beauty with No Transcendent Center, an Idol Rather than an Icon
description:
Karen, Michael and Nate discuss #6 in the list of principles of Radical Orthodoxy, regarding whether or not there is a nullity at the center and what is the role of suffering and love. Random ideas that were generated during the making of this video:

If everything is matter without form, you have a fundamental sameness.
It must be matter and form.
It is through the world of sensible things that we have the opportunity to see beauty.
Any act of creation involves a pouring out of self. 
What principle do we use to judge a script? or a novel? How much is the author sacrificing of himself to give the character a modicum of free will?
Sophia, Wisdom, the world of divine ideas - so beautiful, and yet we risk floating off into space if we are always just up in our heads.
St. Augustine wrote in de Musica of participation and relationally.

Progressivism seeks a progress without cost, but Reality has a real cost at every moment.
Body is important, in one sense, because it amplifies risk.
The focus on beauty without a realization of its transcendence becomes an idol rather than an icon, a self-referential system, a closed system, rather than a portal through which we can see the transcendent.
It is the non-identical repetition that interrupts the self-referential cycle.
Is it a beauty you want to possess? Or one you want to come into union with?
Is it better to be good and look bad or to be bad and look good?
Modernism arises out of a necrophobia that ultimately ends in necrophilia.
Avoiding death ends up celebrating death.
Turning the person into an object, which is what happens in modernity and postmodernity, makes of us exactly what we make of a butterfly when we pin it to a board so that it can be analyzed, dissected .
The minute you conceive of cogito ergo sum, you are like that static butterfly on the board. You are so much more than the working of your mind. You are the sum total of all of your experiences and of all of your relationships and of all of your hopes and dreams. 
Identity politics and intersectionality, or any incomplete ideology, really, is an attempt to fix you eat a particular point in time without regard to who you have been through the past and in this moment and into the future, the sins you will commit, the errors you will make, the collisions with reality, all of which will be met with God's plan to bring good out of your error.
We must live our faith in each moment with a proper aim as we enter into real relationships, conflicts, difficulties etc. For that is how we become an icon rather than a static idol, one in whom Christ can be seen.

Resources discussed:
D C Schindler video on Beauty and Love:
https://youtu.be/ei6eRK28oac?t=1480
Jordan Peterson/ Iain McGilchrist video link to 21:45, his intimations about death and suffering and the role it plays in our lives:
https://youtu.be/xtf4FDlpPZ8?t=1305
